note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Whole lung lavage (left lung) aborted early due to hypoxemia.
Patient: Kevin Foster, 49-year-old male with pulmonary alveolar proteinosis.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with double-lumen ET tube.
Procedure details: Left lung lavage initiated with 1 L aliquots. After 6 L instilled and 4.8 L returned, patient developed refractory hypoxemia despite recruitment maneuvers and increased FiO2.
Decision: Lavage aborted, fluid drained as completely as possible, and both lungs ventilated.
Complications: Hypoxemia to 78 percent, improved after stopping lavage. No hemodynamic collapse.
Disposition: Patient left intubated and transported to ICU for continued respiratory support.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with foreign body removal.
Patient: Noah Brooks, 2-year-old male with suspected peanut aspiration and right middle lobe collapse.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia via rigid pediatric bronchoscope.
Findings: Organic foreign body (peanut fragment) lodged in right middle lobe bronchus with surrounding mucus and inflammation.
Intervention: Foreign body removed using alligator forceps and suction. Airway irrigated and secretions cleared.
Complications: Brief desaturation to 88 percent during retrieval; resolved with bag-mask ventilation. No bleeding or pneumothorax.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and observed on pediatric ward.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with removal of plastic foreign body.
Patient: Sophia King, 5-year-old female with suspected aspiration of small plastic toy and unilateral wheeze.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid pediatric bronchoscope.
Findings: Brightly colored plastic toy fragment lodged in left mainstem bronchus.
Intervention: Foreign body removed using optical grasping forceps in a single piece. Airways suctioned and re-inspected; no residual fragments.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and discharged from PACU to home after several hours of observation.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with removal of dental crown from right lower lobe bronchus.
Patient: Liam Murphy, 34-year-old male who aspirated a dental crown during procedure.
Sedation: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl; native airway with bite block.
Findings: Metallic foreign body visualized in RLL basal segment bronchus.
Intervention: Foreign body grasped and removed using flexible alligator forceps under fluoroscopic guidance. Bronchial mucosa mildly erythematous.
Complications: None other than transient cough.
Disposition: Discharged from bronchoscopy recovery area the same day.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 1 treating right lower lobe.
Patient: Chloe Adams, 45-year-old female with severe persistent asthma on maximal therapy.
Sedation: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl; native airway.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscope used to sequentially treat RLL segmental and subsegmental bronchi with bronchial thermoplasty catheter. Total of 52 activations delivered to RLL.
Complications: Mild wheezing and cough during procedure; no significant desaturation.
Disposition: Observed for 4 hours postprocedure, then discharged home on prednisone burst and usual inhaler regimen.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 2 treating left lower lobe.
Patient: Jason Miller, 52-year-old male with severe asthma status post RLL BT.
Sedation: Monitored anesthesia care with propofol and dexmedetomidine.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscopy performed with BT catheter treatment of LLL segmental and subsegmental bronchi. Total of 48 activations delivered.
Complications: Transient bronchospasm requiring additional bronchodilator therapy; no respiratory failure.
Disposition: Observed 6 hours and discharged home on prednisone taper.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 3 treating bilateral upper lobes.
Patient: Hannah Lewis, 39-year-old female with severe refractory asthma.
Sedation: General anesthesia with laryngeal mask airway.
Procedure details: BT catheter deployed sequentially in RUL and LUL segmental airways. Total of 60 activations delivered (30 per side).
Complications: Mild postprocedure cough and chest tightness; no severe bronchospasm.
Disposition: Admitted overnight for observation due to distance from hospital and prior asthma exacerbations.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies and talc pleurodesis for malignant pleural effusion.
Patient: George Turner, 76-year-old male with recurrent left pleural effusion and suspected malignancy.
Anesthesia: Monitored anesthesia care with local anesthesia and moderate sedation.
Procedure details: Under ultrasound guidance, left 6th intercostal space in midaxillary line selected. 1.5 L of straw-colored fluid drained. Semi-rigid thoracoscope introduced; diffuse parietal pleural nodularity and studding observed. Multiple parietal pleural biopsies taken. Talc slurry pleurodesis performed after complete drainage.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Admitted overnight for pain control and chest tube management.

registry_entry.note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies and talc pleurodesis for malignant pleural effusion.
Patient: George Turner, 76-year-old male with recurrent left pleural effusion and suspected malignancy.
Anesthesia: Monitored anesthesia care with local anesthesia and moderate sedation.
Procedure details: Under ultrasound guidance, left 6th intercostal space in midaxillary line selected. 1.5 L of straw-colored fluid drained. Semi-rigid thoracoscope introduced; diffuse parietal pleural nodularity and studding observed. Multiple parietal pleural biopsies taken. Talc slurry pleurodesis performed after complete drainage.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Admitted overnight for pain control and chest tube management.

registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Daily CXRs; remove chest tube once output low and lung fully expanded

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Ultrasound-guided therapeutic thoracentesis.
Patient: Isabel Morales, 73-year-old female with recurrent right pleural effusion due to heart failure.
Anesthesia: Local anesthesia with lidocaine and mild anxiolysis.
Procedure details: Right posterior 8th intercostal space chosen under ultrasound guidance. 900 mL of clear serous fluid removed via catheter system. Opening pressure not formally measured.
Complications: None; no cough or chest pain.
Disposition: Discharged home after brief observation.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Medical thoracoscopy with tunneled pleural catheter placement and talc poudrage.
Patient: Ethan Hall, 65-year-old male with known metastatic lung cancer and recurrent right malignant pleural effusion.
Sedation: Monitored anesthesia care with moderate sedation and local anesthetic.
Procedure details: Under ultrasound guidance, right 7th intercostal space selected. 1.8 L of serosanguinous pleural fluid drained. Thoracoscopy revealed nodular parietal pleural implants. Talc poudrage pleurodesis performed and indwelling tunneled pleural catheter placed for outpatient drainage.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Admitted overnight; discharged next day with home health support for catheter care.

registry_entry.note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Medical thoracoscopy with tunneled pleural catheter placement and talc poudrage.
Patient: Ethan Hall, 65-year-old male with known metastatic lung cancer and recurrent right malignant pleural effusion.
Sedation: Monitored anesthesia care with moderate sedation and local anesthetic.
Procedure details: Under ultrasound guidance, right 7th intercostal space selected. 1.8 L of serosanguinous pleural fluid drained. Thoracoscopy revealed nodular parietal pleural implants. Talc poudrage pleurodesis performed and indwelling tunneled pleural catheter placed for outpatient drainage.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Admitted overnight; discharged next day with home health support for catheter care.
registry_entry.primary_indication: Recurrent right malignant pleural effusion requiring definitive management
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Moderate right pleural effusion with compressive atelectasis of lower lobe
registry_entry.pleural_procedure_type: Medical thoracoscopy with tunneled pleural catheter
registry_entry.pleural_thoracoscopy_findings: Multiple parietal pleural nodules consistent with metastatic carcinoma
registry_entry.bronch_specimen_tests: Pleural biopsies for histology and molecular profiling
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Malignant pleural disease in setting of metastatic lung cancer
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Outpatient oncology and IP clinic follow-up for catheter management

lines.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with pleurodesis, including pleural biopsies when performed
lines.selection_reason: Medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies and talc pleurodesis for malignant pleural effusion.
note_spans: Medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies, talc pleurodesis, and tunneled pleural catheter placement.

lines.description: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff
lines.selection_reason: Separate indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff placed at thoracoscopy for ongoing outpatient drainage.
note_spans: Placement of tunneled pleural catheter with cuff for long-term drainage after thoracoscopy.

per_code.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with pleurodesis, including pleural biopsies when performed
per_code.notes: Primary pleural thoracoscopy with biopsy and talc pleurodesis.

per_code.description: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff
per_code.notes: Tunneled pleural catheter placement performed in same session as thoracoscopy.

financial_analysis.notes: Totals reflect combined 32609 and 32550; ip_coding_billing NCCI guidance does not bundle tunneled catheter placement into thoracoscopic pleurodesis.

bullets: Operative note documents thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies and talc pleurodesis plus placement of a tunneled pleural catheter for ongoing drainage.
Tunneled pleural catheter insertion (32550) is separately reportable when performed with thoracoscopy and is not bundled into 32609 under current NCCI logic.
